title: ADD SECURITY EXCEPTION
content:
I can send emails, no problem, but can no longer receive them. When I click on download 'new messages' I get a box headed ADD SECURITY EXCEPTION which states that I am "about to override how Thunderbird identifies this site. This site attempts to identify itself with invalid information. Location: pop3talktalk.net:995" The choices are to 'Permanently store this exception' and/or to 'Confirm Security Exception' or 'Cancel' which does nothing. It also hints that someone may be trying to impersonate this site.

I would appreciate any help in getting rid of this rather threatening message and restore my ability to receive emails. I am in my late 70's and not very tech savvy, so I would welcome some simple advice, thanks.

I can check my messages on Webmail, but this is far from ideal.
creator: jandrcooper

title: Calendar reminder notifications window not showing in Windows 11
content:
I recently switched to a new desktop computer running windows 11.

I installed Thunderbird and copied the profile folder accross from my old PC, which was running Windows 10.

Everything appeared as expected when opeing up thunderbird on the new pc - emails, subscribed calendars etc. I can access all calendars and add / modify events etc. I can see that the Google calendars are syncing OK as events added throught Thunderbird show up on my phone when accessing the calendar directly. Reminders also appear on my phone for events added through Thunderbird on my PC, but no reminder window anywhere on my Windows desktop.

I'm wondering if this is a Thunderbird issue or if it's Windows 11 blocking the notifications.

Any help much appreciated
